page.title: 05Dowty Mining 1
page.content: Dowty Mining is a large factory in Ashchurch.It was built in 1943.It was built here because Sir George Dowty already had other factories in the area.They took over an old Birds Custard factory. During World War II they made hydraulic landing gear for aircraft. Now they make pitprops.The first pitprop they made was for Ramcroft Colliery in 1946. In the showroom at Dowty's are two modern pitprops.In the room where they design pitprops there are about ninety computers.If there was a power cut they would run on a supply of batteries.In that room we met a group of 7 Chinese people so that shows that Dowty's is international.Outside there are pitprops all lined up as they would be in mines.Modern pitprops also incorporate a roof support.Then we went into the factory.
